newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bank of Korea intervenes, offers to buy dollars.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Korea intervenes, offers to buy dollars.

text.p: The Bank of Korea intervened in Friday afternoon trading, offering to buy dollars at 894.50 won in one-month forward trading, dealers said.
A dealer said the central bank offered to buy $20 million to limit the won's rise.
Selling pressure on the dollar mounted with expected fund inflows due to the foreign stockholding expansion today.
Dealers estimated some $500 million to $600 million would flow in by next week.
The foreign stock ownership ceiling expanded to 23 percent from 20 percent.
